item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
AMX Logo AMX (formerly AMX, LLC) is an American manufacturer of video switching and control devices. It is currently owned by Samsung Electronics through Harman International Industries, and is part of the Harman Professional Division. Source
You can download the AMX logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: AMX
item.description: AMX (formerly AMX, LLC) is an American manufacturer of video switching and control devices. It is currently owned by Samsung Electronics through Harman International Industries, and is part of the Harman Professional Division. Source

<! [CDATA[
Audio-Technica Corporation (株式会社オーディオテクニカ) Logo Audio-Technica Corporation (株式会社オーディオテクニカ Kabushiki Kaisha Ōdio Tekunika) is a Japanese company that designs and manufactures professional microphones, headphones, phonographic magnetic cartridges, and other audio equipment. Source
You can download the Audio-Technica logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Audio-Technica
item.description: Audio-Technica Corporation (株式会社オーディオテクニカ Kabushiki Kaisha Ōdio Tekunika) is a Japanese company that designs and manufactures professional microphones, headphones, phonographic magnetic cartridges, and other audio equipment. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Beats Electronics Logo Beats Electronics LLC (also known as Beats by Dr. Dre, or simply Beats by Dre) is a subsidiary of Apple Inc. that produces audio products. Headquartered in Culver City, California, the company was founded by music producer and rapper Dr. Dre and Interscope Records co-founder Jimmy Iovine. Source
You can download the Beats logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Beats
item.description: Beats Electronics LLC (also known as Beats by Dr. Dre, or simply Beats by Dre) is a subsidiary of Apple Inc. that produces audio products. Headquartered in Culver City, California, the company was founded by music producer and rapper Dr. Dre and Interscope Records co-founder Jimmy Iovine. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Bose Corporation Logo Bose Corporation is a manufacturing company which predominantly sells audio equipment. The company was established by Amar Bose in 1964 and is based in Framingham, Massachusetts. Bose is best known for its home audio systems and speakers, noise-cancelling headphones, professional audio products and automobile sound systems. Bose has a reputation for being particularly protective of its patents, trademarks, and brands. Source
You can download the Bose logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Bose
item.description: Bose Corporation is a manufacturing company which predominantly sells audio equipment. The company was established by Amar Bose in 1964 and is based in Framingham, Massachusetts. Bose is best known for its home audio systems and speakers, noise-cancelling headphones, professional audio products and automobile sound systems. Bose has a reputation for being particularly protective of its patents, trademarks, and brands. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Crown International Logo Crown International, or Crown Audio, is an American manufacturer of audio electronics, and is a subsidiary of Harman International Industries, which has been part of South Korea-based Samsung Electronics since 2017. Today, the company is known primarily for its power amplifiers, but has also manufactured microphones, a line of commercial audio products as well as digital audio networking products. Source
You can download the Crown Audio logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Crown Audio
item.description: Crown International, or Crown Audio, is an American manufacturer of audio electronics, and is a subsidiary of Harman International Industries, which has been part of South Korea-based Samsung Electronics since 2017. Today, the company is known primarily for its power amplifiers, but has also manufactured microphones, a line of commercial audio products as well as digital audio networking products. Source

dbx, Inc. Logo dbx, Inc. is an American producer of professional audio recording equipment owned by Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of South Korean firm Samsung Electronics. It was founded by David E. Blackmer in 1971. Source
You can download the dbx logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: dbx
item.description: dbx, Inc. is an American producer of professional audio recording equipment owned by Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of South Korean firm Samsung Electronics. It was founded by David E. Blackmer in 1971. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Harman International Logo
Harman International Industries, Inc., commonly known as Harman, is a subsidiary of South Korea-based Samsung Electronics that produces, designs and engineers connected products for automakers, consumers and enterprises worldwide, including connected car systems; audio and visual products, enterprise automation; and connected services. Headquartered in Stamford, Connecticut, Harman maintains major operations in the Americas, Europe, as well as Asia and markets its products under several brands; such as AKG, AMX, Becker, Crown, Harman Kardon, Infinity, JBL, Lexicon, dbx, DigiTech, Mark Levinson, Martin, Revel, Soundcraft, Studer, Arcam, and BSS Audio.
You can download the Harman logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Harman
item.description: Harman International Industries, Inc., commonly known as Harman, is a subsidiary of South Korea-based Samsung Electronics that produces, designs and engineers connected products for automakers, consumers and enterprises worldwide, including connected car systems; audio and visual products, enterprise automation; and connected services. Headquartered in Stamford, Connecticut, Harman maintains major operations in the Americas, Europe, as well as Asia and markets its products under several brands; such as AKG, AMX, Becker, Crown, Harman Kardon, Infinity, JBL, Lexicon, dbx, DigiTech, Mark Levinson, Martin, Revel, Soundcraft, Studer, Arcam, and BSS Audio.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
JBL Logo Harman Kardon (styled as harman / kardon) is a division of Stamford-based Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of South Korean firm Samsung Electronics, and manufactures home and car audio equipment. It was its original division, founded in 1953 by Sidney Harman and Bernard Kardon. Source
You can download the Harman Kardon logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Harman Kardon
item.description: Harman Kardon (styled as harman / kardon) is a division of Stamford-based Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of South Korean firm Samsung Electronics, and manufactures home and car audio equipment. It was its original division, founded in 1953 by Sidney Harman and Bernard Kardon. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Lexicon Logo Lexicon is an American company that engineers, manufactures, and markets audio equipment as a brand of Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of South Korea-based firm Samsung Electronics. The company was founded in 1971 and headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts with offices in Salt Lake City. It was acquired by Harman in 1993. Source
You can download the Lexicon logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Lexicon
item.description: Lexicon is an American company that engineers, manufactures, and markets audio equipment as a brand of Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of South Korea-based firm Samsung Electronics. The company was founded in 1971 and headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts with offices in Salt Lake City. It was acquired by Harman in 1993. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Mark Levinson Audio Systems Logo Mark Levinson is an American high-end audio equipment brand established in 1972 by eponymous founder Mark Levinson, and based in Stamford, Connecticut. It is owned by Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of South Korean company Samsung Electronics. Source
You can download the Mark Levinson logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Mark Levinson
item.description: Mark Levinson is an American high-end audio equipment brand established in 1972 by eponymous founder Mark Levinson, and based in Stamford, Connecticut. It is owned by Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of South Korean company Samsung Electronics. Source

Martin Professional Logo Martin Professional is a Danish manufacturer and distributor of stage and architectural lighting and effects fixtures. It is owned by Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of Samsung Electronics. The company is based in Aarhus, Denmark. Source
You can download the Martin logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Martin
item.description: Martin Professional is a Danish manufacturer and distributor of stage and architectural lighting and effects fixtures. It is owned by Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of Samsung Electronics. The company is based in Aarhus, Denmark. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Revel Logo Revel is an American manufacturer and distributor of high-end luxury audio loudspeakers. It is owned by Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of Samsung Electronics. The company is based in Stamford, Connecticut, United States. Source
You can download the Revel logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Revel
item.description: Revel is an American manufacturer and distributor of high-end luxury audio loudspeakers. It is owned by Harman International Industries, a subsidiary of Samsung Electronics. The company is based in Stamford, Connecticut, United States. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Shure Incorporated Logo Shure Incorporated is an American audio products corporation. It was founded by Sidney N. Shure in Chicago, Illinois in 1925 as a supplier of radio parts kits. The company became a consumer and professional audio-electronics manufacturer of microphones, wireless microphone systems, phonograph cartridges, discussion systems, mixers, and digital signal processing. The company also manufactures listening products, including headphones, high-end earphones, and personal monitor systems. Source Source
You can download the Shure logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Shure
item.description: Shure Incorporated is an American audio products corporation. It was founded by Sidney N. Shure in Chicago, Illinois in 1925 as a supplier of radio parts kits. The company became a consumer and professional audio-electronics manufacturer of microphones, wireless microphone systems, phonograph cartridges, discussion systems, mixers, and digital signal processing. The company also manufactures listening products, including headphones, high-end earphones, and personal monitor systems. Source Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Sonos Logo Sonos is an American consumer electronics company based in Santa Barbara, California. It was founded in 2002 by John MacFarlane, Craig Shelburne, Tom Cullen, and Trung Mai, and is currently run by Patrick Spence. Sonos is widely known for the smart speakers it develops and manufactures. Sonos products are designed to allow speakers to play music simultaneously in multiple rooms. Source
You can download the Sonos logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Sonos
item.description: Sonos is an American consumer electronics company based in Santa Barbara, California. It was founded in 2002 by John MacFarlane, Craig Shelburne, Tom Cullen, and Trung Mai, and is currently run by Patrick Spence. Sonos is widely known for the smart speakers it develops and manufactures. Sonos products are designed to allow speakers to play music simultaneously in multiple rooms. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Soundcraft Logo Soundcraft is a British designer and importer (formerly a manufacturer) of mixing consoles and other professional audio equipment. It is a subsidiary of Harman International Industries, which is owned by South Korean company Samsung Electronics. It was founded by sound engineer Phil Dudderidge and electronics designer Graham Blyth in 1973. Source
You can download the Soundcraft logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Soundcraft
item.description: Soundcraft is a British designer and importer (formerly a manufacturer) of mixing consoles and other professional audio equipment. It is a subsidiary of Harman International Industries, which is owned by South Korean company Samsung Electronics. It was founded by sound engineer Phil Dudderidge and electronics designer Graham Blyth in 1973. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Studer Logo Studer is a Swiss designer and manufacturer of audio equipment for recording studios and broadcasters. The company was founded in Zürich, Switzerland, in 1948 by Willi Studer. It initially became known in the 1950s for its professional tape recorders. In the 1990s the company moved into the manufacture of mixing consoles. Source
You can download the Studer logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Studer
item.description: Studer is a Swiss designer and manufacturer of audio equipment for recording studios and broadcasters. The company was founded in Zürich, Switzerland, in 1948 by Willi Studer. It initially became known in the 1950s for its professional tape recorders. In the 1990s the company moved into the manufacture of mixing consoles. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Yamaha Corporation Logo Yamaha Corporation is a Japanese multinational corporation and conglomerate with a very wide range of products and services. It is one of the constituents of Nikkei 225 and is the world’s largest piano manufacturing company. The former motorcycle division was established in 1955 as Yamaha Motor Co., Ltd., which started as an affiliated company but later became independent, although Yamaha Corporation is still a major shareholder. Source
You can download the Yamaha logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Yamaha
item.description: Yamaha Corporation is a Japanese multinational corporation and conglomerate with a very wide range of products and services. It is one of the constituents of Nikkei 225 and is the world’s largest piano manufacturing company. The former motorcycle division was established in 1955 as Yamaha Motor Co., Ltd., which started as an affiliated company but later became independent, although Yamaha Corporation is still a major shareholder. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
AKG Acoustics Logo AKG Acoustics (originally Akustische und Kino-Geräte Gesellschaft m.b.H., English: Acoustic and Cinema Equipment) is an acoustics engineering and manufacturing company. It was founded in 1947 by Dr. Rudolf Görike and Ernest Plass in Vienna, Austria. It is a subsidiary of Harman International Industries, a division of Samsung Electronics. Source
You can download the AKG logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: AKG
item.description: AKG Acoustics (originally Akustische und Kino-Geräte Gesellschaft m.b.H., English: Acoustic and Cinema Equipment) is an acoustics engineering and manufacturing company. It was founded in 1947 by Dr. Rudolf Görike and Ernest Plass in Vienna, Austria. It is a subsidiary of Harman International Industries, a division of Samsung Electronics. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Pioneer (パイオニア) Logo Pioneer Corporation (パイオニア株式会社 Paionia Kabushiki-kaisha) commonly referred to as Pioneer, is a Japanese multinational corporation based in Tokyo, Japan, that specializes in digital entertainment products. The company was founded by Nozomu Matsumoto in 1938 in Tokyo as a radio and speaker repair shop, and its current president is Susumu Kotani. Source
You can download the Pioneer logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Pioneer
item.description: Pioneer Corporation (パイオニア株式会社 Paionia Kabushiki-kaisha) commonly referred to as Pioneer, is a Japanese multinational corporation based in Tokyo, Japan, that specializes in digital entertainment products. The company was founded by Nozomu Matsumoto in 1938 in Tokyo as a radio and speaker repair shop, and its current president is Susumu Kotani. Source
